comment_text.mn113:3.11: By rejecting social measures of worth and focusing on inner purity, they are the opposite of the meditator at MN 108:26.4, who hides defilements within.
comment_text.mn113:21.7: For atammayatā see MN 47:13.4 and my note there. Here it means that one’s spiritual goal is not limited to this attainment.
comment_text.mn113:21.8: This saying also appears at Snp 3.8:15.1 and Snp 3.12:52.1, where it is not connected with absorption practice.

root_text.mn113:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.mn113:2.2: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
root_text.mn113:2.3: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
root_text.mn113:3.2: Idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso uccākulā pabbajito hoti.
root_text.mn113:3.4: ‘ahaṁ khomhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā’ti.
root_text.mn113:3.5: So tāya uccākulīnatāya attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:3.7: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:3.8: ‘na kho uccākulīnatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:3.10: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:3.11: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya uccākulīnatāya nevattānukkaṁseti na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:4-6.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso mahākulā pabbajito hoti …pe…
root_text.mn113:4-6.5: ‘ahaṁ khomhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā’ti.
root_text.mn113:4-6.6: So tāya uḷārabhogatāya attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:4-6.8: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:4-6.9: ‘na kho uḷārabhogatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:4-6.11: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:4-6.12: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya uḷārabhogatāya nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:7.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ñāto hoti yasassī.
root_text.mn113:7.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ñāto yasassī, ime panaññe bhikkhū appaññātā appesakkhā’ti.
root_text.mn113:7.4: So tena ñattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:7.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:7.7: ‘na kho ñattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:7.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:7.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena ñattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:8.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
root_text.mn113:8.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi lābhī cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ, ime panaññe bhikkhū na lābhino cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan’ti.
root_text.mn113:8.4: So tena lābhena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:8.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:8.7: ‘na kho lābhena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:8.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:8.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena lābhena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:9.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso bahussuto hoti.
root_text.mn113:9.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi bahussuto, ime panaññe bhikkhū na bahussutā’ti.
root_text.mn113:9.4: So tena bāhusaccena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:9.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:9.7: ‘na kho bāhusaccena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:9.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:9.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena bāhusaccena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:10.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vinayadharo hoti.
root_text.mn113:10.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi vinayadharo, ime panaññe bhikkhū na vinayadharā’ti.
root_text.mn113:10.4: So tena vinayadharattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:10.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:10.7: ‘na kho vinayadharattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:10.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:10.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena vinayadharattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:11.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso dhammakathiko hoti.
root_text.mn113:11.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi dhammakathiko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na dhammakathikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:11.4: So tena dhammakathikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:11.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:11.7: ‘na kho dhammakathikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:11.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:11.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena dhammakathikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:12.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti.
root_text.mn113:12.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi āraññiko ime panaññe bhikkhū na āraññikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:12.4: So tena āraññikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:12.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:12.7: ‘na kho āraññikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:12.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:12.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena āraññikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:13.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso paṁsukūliko hoti.
root_text.mn113:13.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi paṁsukūliko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na paṁsukūlikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:13.4: So tena paṁsukūlikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:13.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:13.7: ‘na kho paṁsukūlikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:13.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:13.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena paṁsukūlikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:14.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso piṇḍapātiko hoti.
root_text.mn113:14.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi piṇḍapātiko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na piṇḍapātikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:14.4: So tena piṇḍapātikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:14.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:14.7: ‘na kho piṇḍapātikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:14.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:14.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena piṇḍapātikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:15.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso rukkhamūliko hoti.
root_text.mn113:15.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi rukkhamūliko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na rukkhamūlikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:15.4: So tena rukkhamūlikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:15.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:15.7: ‘na kho rukkhamūlikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:15.9: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:15.10: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena rukkhamūlikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:16-20.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sosāniko hoti …pe…
root_text.mn113:16-20.7: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ekāsaniko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na ekāsanikā’ti.
root_text.mn113:16-20.8: So tena ekāsanikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:16-20.10: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:16-20.11: ‘na kho ekāsanikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
root_text.mn113:16-20.13: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
root_text.mn113:16-20.14: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena ekāsanikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:21.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
root_text.mn113:21.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:21.4: So tāya paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:21.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:21.8: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:21.9: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:22-24.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn113:22-24.5: ‘ahaṁ khomhi catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:22-24.6: So tāya catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:22-24.8: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:22-24.10: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:22-24.11: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:25.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
root_text.mn113:25.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:25.4: So tāya ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:25.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:25.8: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:25.9: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:26.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
root_text.mn113:26.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:26.4: So tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:26.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:26.8: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:26.9: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:27.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
root_text.mn113:27.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:27.4: So tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:27.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:27.8: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:27.9: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:28.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
root_text.mn113:28.3: ‘ahaṁ khomhi nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
root_text.mn113:28.4: So tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:28.6: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
root_text.mn113:28.8: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
root_text.mn113:28.9: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
root_text.mn113:29.1: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, sappuriso sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati. Paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
root_text.mn113:29.2: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na kiñci maññati, na kuhiñci maññati, na kenaci maññatī”ti.
root_text.mn113:29.4: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.

translation_text.mn113:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.mn113:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
translation_text.mn113:2.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the qualities of a true person and the qualities of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:2.2: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.mn113:3.1: “And what is a quality of an untrue person?
translation_text.mn113:3.2: Take an untrue person who has gone forth from an eminent family.
translation_text.mn113:3.4: ‘I have gone forth from an eminent family, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:3.5: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:3.6: This is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:3.8: ‘It’s not because of one’s eminent family that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:3.9: Even if someone has not gone forth from an eminent family,
translation_text.mn113:3.10: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’
translation_text.mn113:3.11: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their eminent family.
translation_text.mn113:3.12: This is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:4-6.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who has gone forth from a great family …
translation_text.mn113:4-6.5: ‘I have gone forth from an extremely wealthy family, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:4-6.6: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:4-6.7: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:4-6.9: ‘It’s not because of one’s extremely wealthy family that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:4-6.10: Even if someone has not gone forth from an extremely wealthy family,
translation_text.mn113:4-6.11: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’
translation_text.mn113:4-6.12: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their extremely wealthy family.
translation_text.mn113:4-6.13: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:7.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who is well-known and famous.
translation_text.mn113:7.3: ‘I’m well-known and famous. These other mendicants are obscure and insignificant.’
translation_text.mn113:7.4: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:7.5: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:7.7: ‘It’s not because of one’s fame that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:7.8: Even if someone is not well-known and famous,
translation_text.mn113:7.9: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’
translation_text.mn113:7.10: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their fame.
translation_text.mn113:7.11: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:8.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who receives robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
translation_text.mn113:8.3: ‘I receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:8.4: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:8.5: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:8.7: ‘It’s not because of one’s material things that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:8.8: Even if someone doesn’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick,
translation_text.mn113:8.9: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’
translation_text.mn113:8.10: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their material things.
translation_text.mn113:8.11: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:9.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who is very learned …
translation_text.mn113:10.1: who is an expert in the monastic law …
translation_text.mn113:13.1: who is a rag robe wearer …
translation_text.mn113:15.1: who stays at the root of a tree …
translation_text.mn113:16-20.1: who stays in a charnel ground …
translation_text.mn113:16-20.2: who stays in the open air …
translation_text.mn113:16-20.4: who sleeps wherever they lay their mat …
translation_text.mn113:16-20.5: who eats in one sitting per day.
translation_text.mn113:16-20.7: ‘I eat in one sitting per day, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:16-20.8: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:16-20.9: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:16-20.11: ‘It’s not because of eating in one sitting per day that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:16-20.12: Even if someone eats in more than one sitting per day,
translation_text.mn113:16-20.13: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’
translation_text.mn113:16-20.14: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their eating in one sitting per day.
translation_text.mn113:16-20.15: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:21.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
translation_text.mn113:21.3: ‘I have attained the first absorption, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:21.4: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:21.5: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:21.7: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the first absorption.
translation_text.mn113:21.8: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’
translation_text.mn113:21.9: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the first absorption.
translation_text.mn113:21.10: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:22-24.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, enters and remains in the second absorption …
translation_text.mn113:22-24.5: ‘I have attained the fourth absorption, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:22-24.6: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:22-24.7: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:22-24.9: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the fourth absorption.
translation_text.mn113:22-24.10: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’
translation_text.mn113:22-24.11: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the fourth absorption.
translation_text.mn113:22-24.12: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:25.1: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space …
translation_text.mn113:28.1: the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
translation_text.mn113:28.3: ‘I have attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, unlike these other mendicants.’
translation_text.mn113:28.4: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.
translation_text.mn113:28.5: This too is a quality of an untrue person.
translation_text.mn113:28.7: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
translation_text.mn113:28.8: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’
translation_text.mn113:28.9: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
translation_text.mn113:28.10: This too is a quality of a true person.
translation_text.mn113:29.1: Furthermore, take a true person who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
translation_text.mn113:29.2: This is a mendicant who does not conceive with anything, does not conceive regarding anything, does not conceive through anything.”
translation_text.mn113:29.3: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn113:29.4: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.

variant_text.mn113:7.4: ñattena → ñātattena (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed); ñātena (si, mr)
variant_text.mn113:29.2: Ayaṁ → ayaṁ kho (bj, sya-all, km); ayampi (si); ayaṁ pi (pts1ed)

reference_text.mn113:8.1: csp1ed11.88, csp2ed11.88, dr13.124, ms11M_283, ndp11.103, nya8, pts-vp-pli3.39
reference_text.mn113:21.1: cck14.133, ms11M_292, msdiv108, nya21, pts-vp-pli3.43, sya14.141, vri14.91
